metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30858 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.8 and iPadOS 14.8, macOS Big Sur 11.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-30858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.33.90-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.90-1ubuntu1').
wpewebkit package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
